title: Aamir Khan goes back to school!
text:
Aamir Khan goes back to school! By India.com Entertainment Desk on October 25, 2015 at 1:27 AM Comments 
He is not called Mr Perfectionist of B-town for nothing. Aamir Khan levies no stone unturned to slip into his character and makes sure that everything goes right for the project he chooses to do–including the backdrop and location selected for a scene. The same holds true for his much-awaited next Dangal. ALSO READ: Aamir Khan not working on Lagaan sequel 
Aamir Khan has been in an extensive shoot schedule of Dangal in Punjab. Last we heard that he shot in Dharmendra’s ancestral village Dango and how Aamir even told him that once the film is ready, he would organize for a special screening for him. The latest news from Punjab is that Aamir Khan and the Dangal team recently shot in the oldest school of Punjab. 
The school is called The Government Senior Secondary School in Gujjarwal which was established in 1857. The school also had Kartar Singh Sarabha (Sikh freedom fighter) as one of its students. Aamir was thrilled to have shot in the school. He met the school’s principal and his entire family. Aamir has gone under a physical transformation for his role of a wrestler in the film and it will be his next film after the record breaking film, PK.
